msg.data:
About

Lab: Hive and Spark
Objective: Become familiar with using Hive and Spark tabl
File locations: /home/devuser/data/telco

                hdfs:///data/telco

Successful outcome: Understanding Hive and Spark integration
Before you begin: N/A
Related lessons: Spark Overview

paragraphs.title: Get the data and store it into /tmp/telco

msg.data: rm: cannot remove ‘/tmp/telco’: No such file or directory

paragraphs.title: Move the data into HDFS /data/telco
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/telco
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /data/telco/accounts
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -put /tmp/telco/accounts/* /data/telco/accounts/

paragraphs.title: Grant Hive access to the data

-rw-r--r--   3 hive hdfs        129 2020-06-13 17:49 /data/telco/accounts/part-m-00004

paragraphs.text:
%md
We are going to create an Hive external table
~~~
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS telco.accounts;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE telco.accounts (
    acct_num INT,
    acct_create_dt TIMESTAMP,
    acct_close_dt  TIMESTAMP,
    first_name VARCHAR(255)  ,
    last_name VARCHAR(255) ,
    address  VARCHAR(255) ,
    city  VARCHAR(255) ,
    state VARCHAR(255) ,
    zipcode VARCHAR(255) ,
    phone_number VARCHAR(255) ,
    created TIMESTAMP  ,
    modified TIMESTAMP
    )
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
STORED AS TEXTFILE
LOCATION '/user/zeppelin/hive/telco.db/accounts';

~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

msg.data:
We are going to create an Hive external table

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS telco.accounts_stage;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE telco.accounts_stage (
    acct_num INT,
    acct_create_dt TIMESTAMP,
    acct_close_dt  TIMESTAMP,
    first_name VARCHAR(255)  ,
    last_name VARCHAR(255) ,
    address  VARCHAR(255) ,
    city  VARCHAR(255) ,
    state VARCHAR(255) ,
    zipcode VARCHAR(255) ,
    phone_number VARCHAR(255) ,
    created TIMESTAMP  ,
    modified TIMESTAMP
    )
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
STORED AS TEXTFILE
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/telco_stage.db/accounts_stage';

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 1 - Drop, create and use database telco
2 - Use HDFS to compare the external and managed tablespace for hive
3 - Drop and create external table accounts
4 - Allow zeppelin to have write permission

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created a Hive tabled to be used by Spark. The instructor will now assign you Zeppelin notebooks that will use Spark and this table.

---

msg.data:
Result

You have now: You have now successfully created a Hive tabled to be used by Spark. The instructor will now assign you Zeppelin notebooks that will use Spark and this table.

paragraphs.title: 1 - Drop, create and use database telco
3 - Get zeppelin eternal directory setup
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r /user/zeppelin/hive
sudo -u zeppelin hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /user/zeppelin/hive
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -chmod -R 777 /user/zeppelin/hive
hdfs dfs -ls /user/zeppelin/ | grep hive

msg.data:
rm: `/user/zeppelin/hive': No such file or directory
drwxrwxrwx   - zeppelin hdfs          0 2020-06-13 20:32 /user/zeppelin/hive

paragraphs.title: 3 - Drop and create external table accounts
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS telco.accounts;

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE telco.accounts (
    acct_num INT,
    acct_create_dt TIMESTAMP,
    acct_close_dt  TIMESTAMP,
    first_name VARCHAR(255)  ,
    last_name VARCHAR(255) ,
    address  VARCHAR(255) ,
    city  VARCHAR(255) ,
    state VARCHAR(255) ,
    zipcode VARCHAR(255) ,
    phone_number VARCHAR(255) ,
    created TIMESTAMP  ,
    modified TIMESTAMP)
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
STORED AS TEXTFILE
LOCATION '/user/zeppelin/hive/telco/accounts';

paragraphs.title: 5 - Load data into accounts
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
LOAD DATA INPATH '/data/telco/accounts' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE telco.accounts;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Cloudera Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.

msg.data:
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

  1. Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
  2. Cloudera Community Connection (HCC) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
  3. Cloudera Apache Spark Docs - official Spark documentation.
  4. Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs - official Zeppelin documentation.
